text: Many people associate the word crystal with delicate wine goblets or glassy objects with smooth sides and gem-like shapes.

Therefore, all mineral samples are crystals or crystalline solids, even if they lack smooth-sided faces.
Give an example of a mineral that supports your answer.
Describe a simple chemical test that is useful in identifying the mineral calcite.
In geology, the term crystal or crystalline refers to any natural solid with an orderly, repeating internal structure.
Distinguish between compositional and structural variations in minerals and provide one example of each.

However, the quartz crystals in the sample of granite shown in do not display well-defined faces.
Both quartz samples are nonetheless crystalline.
